channel.title: Single Player
channel.description:
I've been thinking about single-player based games lately, which has led to my idea to work on a single-player RSPS. The concept of this is pretty much straightforward and will involve a lot of questing and exploring, but in a different fashion than RuneScape originally introduced. There will obviously be a lot of work required, such as:
[ul][li]Removing any multi-player content[/li] [li]Adding new armor and weapons[/li] [li]Adding new monsters and npcs[/li] [li]Possibly creating new maps[/li][/ul]
There will be many more things implemented, but this is still just an idea. Before I actually start working on this, I was wanting to get feedback about it. If you have any questions/comments, please post them.

item.title: Single Player
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:47, topic:459698”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=562604.msg4167583#msg4167583 date=1353876763]

LUL SKYRIMSKAPE

No really, it’s a good idea. Try not to be influenced by any other games (e.g. Skyrim) as being unique is what makes certain games fun.

Taking inspiration and being influenced by Video Games is never a bad thing. It’s when you copy them is when it becomes an issue.

Saying it’s “never a bad thing” is a lie. Also, on a side note, ‘video games’ is a plural noun/identifier, not a proper noun. No need to capitalize it.

I capitalized it because it was important. Please explain to me how It’s a bad thing without using the Call of Duty series (or other rehashers) as an example.
[/quote]
I never said it IS a bad thing, I only said that what you said was a lie. Saying it’s “never a bad thing” is a complete lie, because there are no qualifiers. Google “Great Giana Sisters” and then try telling me that being influenced by other games is, “never a bad thing”.[/quote]

O.K. you’re right. Is that what you want to hear? Can we stop this now? You and I both know why I said that and what I meant.

Read full topic

item.title: Single Player
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“atrabilious, post:38, topic:459698”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=562604.msg4162956#msg4162956 date=1353325180]

i cant wait for this release. i have some amazing ideas to implement into my own single player version of rune. any idea on an eta?

You’re so uninformed to the situation that it’s sad…
[/quote]

and why would that be then? why be such a douche you crettin.[/quote]
There was no release, nor do I even expect to see one. It would be so much easier just working on a new game of your own rather than creating a ‘new’ game from something that already existed.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:33, topic:459698”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=562604.msg4162526#msg4162526 date=1353271889]
The fact that you are “good” at client and server development is completely irrelevant here, all you need is a good project, and a renamed, documented client. I’m thinking about starting something like this with a client somewhere from the 194 to 317 revision. I’ll just have to do the renaming myself if I can’t find a good client that’s already been released.
[/quote]
if you think good is irrelevant, then we have a team already!
Let’s hop in the help section and gather em all together to do this![/quote]not everyone in the help section are idiots :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Single Player
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:30, topic:459698”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=562604.msg4162513#msg4162513 date=1353271319]

Since I have nothing to do, I’ve put a client and server together, I’ve made a Launcher class that launches both the server and the client together.
Will clean up a bit and release it soon so people interested in single player could build of it.

Might remove networking and implement client with server in my spare time.

I’d love to work on it, I’ve always had loads of idea for a game yet never really bothered to setup everything, so if you would provide this I would be quite happy.

Took me like a good half hour to set this up every one with some knowledge can easily do it himself.
Just put the client files with the server files, make a launcher class and add the client and server run methods into the launcher one,
edit the player handling so it only accepts one connection so you can remove everything that handles multiplayer.

Removing networking would be the next step followed by stop handling client and server files separate.
e.g. Packets could be handled straight away instead of going via the client files and converting for the server ones.
My bare client knowledge stops me from doing this though.
[/quote]
You don’t need to handle packets at all, just strip it down to the mouse listeners.[/quote]
Wouldn’t be able to do it myself.

We should get some good client and server developers together to create a clean base for single player projects.

Read full topic

Just put the client files with the server files, make a launcher class and add the client and server run methods into the launcher one,

Removing networking would be the next step followed by stop handling client and server files separate.
e.g. Packets could be handled straight away instead of going via the client files and converting for the server ones.
My bare client knowledge stops me from doing this though.[/quote]
You don’t need to handle packets at all, just strip it down to the mouse listeners.
